trial_identification.studytitle: Sodium control in aneurysmal subarachnoid haemorrhage
trial_identification.scientifictitle: The effect of fludrocortisone plus standard care on sodium control in aneurysmal subarachnoid haemorrhage

interventions.interventions: Fludrocortisone 100mcg oral tablet twice daily in addition to standard care until hyponatremia resolves per twice daily serum electrolytes Adherence ensured by tablets being administered by nursing staff on hospital ward
interventions.comparator: Comparator is standard medical care: intravenous fluid, and possibly oral fluid restriction and/or intravenous hypertonic saline

primaryOutcome.outcome: Sodium nadir by twice daily serum electrolytes

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Duration sodium <135mmol/L according to twice daily serum electrolytes
Duration and intensity of oral fluid restriction, according to mL oral fluid consumed daily
Duration and intensity of hypertonic saline delivery, according to mL hypertonic saline delivered daily

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Inclusion: * D1-18 aneurysmal SAH * Serum Na <135mmol/L
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Exclusion: * Thyroid abnormality * Cortisol abnormality * Pre-morbid cardiopulmonary disease * Pre-morbid electrolyte imbalance * Pre-morbid treated hypertension * Pre-morbid systemic fungal infection * Women who are pregnant * Children and/or young people (<18 years) * Aged (>80 years)

sponsorship.primarysponsoraddress: Department of Diabetes and Endocrinology, Princess Alexandra Hospital 25 Manson Pde Yeronga Qld 4104

ethicsAndSummary.summary: Hyponatremia, which describes low blood sodium levels, occurs frequently in patients who are in the hospital after aneurysmal subarachnoid haemorrhage, a condition where there has been bleeding in the brain. Hyponatremia can cause confusion and seizures, and possibly long term effects on a patients ability to function. A substantial amount of resources are used in treating this condition. This study looks at determining whether a medication called fludrocortisone can help in reducing the severity and duration of hyponatremia in this setting.
